intro: Taraxacum thorvaldii, commonly known as the Thorvald's dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of spoon-shaped leaves and a distinctive yellow composite flower head. Native to southern Scandinavia, this plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and open habitats. It produces a long, hollow stem with a terminal flower that develops into a white, fluffy seed head. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its resilience in harsh environments.
